title: Self-Reliance & Achievement Orientation
subtitle: Building Your Future
description: Develop a growth mindset and learn to take initiative in building your career and skills. This module helps you move beyond dependency on connections and fate, focusing on strategic thinking, continuous learning, and proactive self-development.
completionMessage: You have learned to take ownership of your development and career path. You now understand how to balance tradition with innovation, invest in yourself strategically, and create opportunities through self-reliance rather than depending solely on connections or accepting fate.

questions.title: Post-Graduation Job Search
questions.scenario: After completing your bachelor's degree, you've been unemployed for eight months despite applying to many jobs. Your family suggests that your uncle, who has government connections, could arrange a position for you. However, you're also considering starting a small online business.
questions.question: Which approach best demonstrates self-reliance?

options.text: Accept the family connection since unemployment is becoming longer
options.feedback: While solving immediate problems, this reinforces dependency on connections rather than building personal capabilities.

options.text: Pursue both entrepreneurship and skill development while continuing job applications
options.feedback: This shows proactive self-reliance by creating multiple pathways and building skills regardless of immediate outcomes.

options.text: Wait for the perfect job that matches your exact qualifications
options.feedback: Passive waiting demonstrates fatalistic thinking and misses opportunities for growth and learning.

options.text: Take the government job through connections and forget about business ideas
options.feedback: This completely abandons entrepreneurial potential and reinforces the connection-based system you could help change.

questions.title: Struggling Family Business
questions.scenario: Your family business is struggling financially, and relatives suggest taking a large loan from informal lenders (with high interest) to continue operations. Alternatively, you could downsize significantly and rebuild gradually with your own resources.
questions.question: What demonstrates the most sustainable self-reliance?

options.text: Take the informal loan to maintain current business size
options.feedback: High-interest informal loans often lead to debt traps and don't address underlying business challenges.

options.text: Downsize and rebuild systematically with available resources
options.feedback: This shows sustainable thinking by working within means while maintaining business viability and learning.

options.text: Close the business completely since it's not working
options.feedback: Giving up entirely misses the opportunity to learn from challenges and build resilience.

options.text: Ask extended family members to invest in the business
options.feedback: While family investment might help, it creates dependency and obligation that might not be sustainable.

questions.title: Investing in Skills
questions.scenario: You want to learn digital marketing skills to improve your career prospects, but the good courses are expensive. Your friends suggest that formal courses are unnecessary and that you can learn everything for free online.
questions.question: What approach shows the most proactive self-development?

options.text: Only use free online resources since paid courses are not worth the money
options.feedback: While free resources are valuable, dismissing all paid education might limit access to structured learning and networking.

options.text: Evaluate different learning options and invest strategically in your education
options.feedback: This demonstrates strategic thinking about personal development and willingness to invest in yourself.

options.text: Wait until you have enough money for the most expensive course available
options.feedback: Perfectionist thinking that delays action often results in missed opportunities.

options.text: Give up on digital marketing and focus on skills that don't require investment
options.feedback: Avoiding growth opportunities limits long-term potential and career options.

questions.title: Traditional vs. Modern Farming
questions.scenario: Your agricultural family wants you to continue traditional farming methods that have been used for generations. However, you've researched modern techniques that could increase productivity and income, but they require initial investment and learning new approaches.
questions.question: How do you balance tradition with progress?

options.text: Follow traditional methods completely to respect family wisdom
options.feedback: Complete traditionalism might miss opportunities for improvement and economic growth.

options.text: Research and gradually implement proven modern techniques while maintaining valuable traditions
options.feedback: This shows balanced thinking that respects heritage while pursuing improvement and innovation.

options.text: Completely abandon traditional methods for modern approaches
options.feedback: Completely abandoning tradition might ignore valuable indigenous knowledge and create family conflict.

options.text: Move away from agriculture entirely to avoid the conflict
options.feedback: Avoiding the challenge doesn't solve the problem and wastes family agricultural knowledge.

questions.title: Migration vs. Local Development
questions.scenario: You've heard that many young Nepalese people are succeeding by migrating to other countries for work. Your friends encourage you to follow this path, but you're also interested in contributing to Nepal's development while building your career.
questions.question: What approach demonstrates constructive self-reliance?

options.text: Migrate immediately since that's where the opportunities are
options.feedback: While migration can provide opportunities, immediate departure might miss local potential and doesn't address systemic issues.

options.text: Develop skills that can contribute to both Nepal and global markets
options.feedback: This develops versatile capabilities that create options for both local contribution and global opportunities.

options.text: Stay in Nepal regardless of opportunities elsewhere
options.feedback: Rigid domestic focus might limit personal growth and ignore global learning opportunities.

options.text: Make the decision based on what most of your friends are doing
options.feedback: Following peer pressure rather than personal analysis leads to decisions that might not fit your situation.

questions.title: Starting Freelancing
questions.scenario: You want to start freelancing online, but a friend says, 'Without expensive equipment and connections, it's pointless -- better wait until you have everything perfect.'
questions.question: What demonstrates achievement-oriented self-reliance?

options.text: Wait until you can buy the best equipment and have strong connections
options.feedback: Perfectionism can delay action indefinitely and kill momentum.

options.text: Start with available resources, build a portfolio, and improve step-by-step
options.feedback: This is realistic and growth-oriented: iterate, learn, and scale.

options.text: Give up because the market is too competitive
options.feedback: Avoidance prevents skill-building and opportunity discovery.

options.text: Copy other freelancers' work to appear experienced quickly
options.feedback: Short-term gain through dishonesty creates long-term risk and reputation damage.

questions.title: Failing an Important Exam
questions.scenario: You fail an important entrance exam. Relatives say, 'It wasn't in your destiny,' and suggest you stop trying and accept whatever comes.
questions.question: What response shows self-reliant achievement orientation?

options.text: Accept fate and stop preparing for future attempts
options.feedback: Fatalism discourages learning and personal control over outcomes.

options.text: Review what went wrong, adjust strategy, and build a structured improvement plan
options.feedback: This treats failure as feedback and builds competence through iteration.

options.text: Blame the system entirely and do nothing else
options.feedback: Systems can be flawed, but progress still needs actionable steps.

options.text: Decide you are not smart enough and avoid similar challenges
options.feedback: Fixed mindset blocks growth and reduces future opportunities.

questions.title: Job Choice: Security vs. Growth
questions.scenario: You are offered a job through connections with very low learning opportunities. Another option is a smaller role with lower salary but strong skill development and mentorship.
questions.question: What best reflects long-term achievement orientation?

options.text: Choose the connection-based job because it's safer
options.feedback: Short-term security can trap you in low-skill, low-mobility paths.

options.text: Prioritize the role that builds skills and long-term growth, even if it starts smaller
options.feedback: Skill accumulation increases future options and earning power.

options.text: Refuse both and wait for a 'perfect' job
options.feedback: Waiting without action can prolong stagnation.

options.text: Choose based only on what will impress others
options.feedback: External validation is unreliable and can lead to poor career fit.

questions.title: Climate-Resilient Farming
questions.scenario: Your family farm is facing unpredictable rainfall. A neighbor suggests experimenting with more resilient practices, but elders say, 'We've always done it this way.'
questions.question: What is the most self-reliant and constructive approach?

options.text: Follow tradition only and reject new methods
options.feedback: Rigid traditionalism can increase vulnerability to new risks.

options.text: Learn and pilot proven climate-resilient practices on a small scale before expanding
options.feedback: This respects tradition while adapting to changing conditions through evidence-based experimentation.

options.text: Quit agriculture completely without exploring solutions
options.feedback: Abandonment avoids the problem rather than building adaptive capacity.

options.text: Borrow heavily to change everything at once without testing
options.feedback: High-risk, unproven large-scale changes can lead to financial disaster.

World Bank: Climate-Smart Agriculture

questions.title: Scholarship Application Rejection
questions.scenario: You apply for a study-abroad scholarship and get rejected. Friends say, 'Maybe you're not meant to study abroad,' and suggest you give up on that dream.
questions.question: What shows self-reliant achievement thinking?

options.text: Give up and assume it wasn't meant to be
options.feedback: Fatalism stops you from learning and improving for future attempts.

options.text: Seek feedback, strengthen weak areas, and apply to other programs or reapply next cycle
options.feedback: This treats rejection as information for improvement and persists with strategy.

options.text: Blame the selection committee for bias and stop trying
options.feedback: Blaming others without self-reflection prevents growth.

options.text: Use family connections to pressure the scholarship committee
options.feedback: This reinforces patronage rather than building genuine qualifications.
